result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton W. Dettman

defendant.name: Dettman, Colton W.
defendant.address: 196 S. Main St, Mt. Sterling, WI 54645

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Colton W. Dettman appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Colton W. Dettman.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kieler is heard and they're ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing. 

1W - Deputy M. Ploessl, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Kieler 

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Kieler objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.  
Attorney Kieler is heard and they're prepared to go ahead with the arraignment today. 

Court is heard on the two Forfeiture matters that have appeared back on the calendar with the criminal cases, 22FO72 and 22TR455 which were defaulted on 6/20/2022.  
Attorney Steiner is heard and has nothing in notes as to why the traffic matters were following along. 
Court makes a finding that these two defaulted cases will no longer ride along with the criminal cases as they were properly disposed of back in June. 
Court advises right to reopen if defendant would choose to do so.  No comment by defendant. 

22CF154 - waives reading of the information. Defendant plead not guilty. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 
22CF102 - waives reading of the information. Defendant plead not guilty. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 
22CM30 - Defendant plead not guilty. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Jury status hearing on January 5, 2023 at 09:15 am.

10:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Colton W. Dettman in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

No Attorney has been assigned to this case at this time. 
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

10:10 AM 
Defendant is heard on financial status, requests that Attorney Kieler be assigned this new case. Attorney Kieler is heard and will take this new bail jumping case. 
Attorney Kieler accepts. Payment remain the same as in the other cases

Set this case for a prelim hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Colton W Dettman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $250.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $250.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement.
